intro: Mussaenda chingii, commonly known as the Chinese flame bush, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright yellow flowers clustered in terminal panicles. The plant has ovate to elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Mussaenda chingii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
